responsibilities: Undertaking research, to support the planning and delivery of the research activity, which will include: Investigate, characterise, and develop ontologies of software vulnerabilities in the edge computing environment.

Monitor and/or analyse source code (and data), software behaviours, and software environment (e.g., hardware failure, sensor degradation, etc.) to identify potential vulnerabilities and assess their impacts.
Predict or identify vulnerabilities early, to fix them quickly and effectively, preventing potential exploitation.
Investigate the software quality certification/robustness to cyber disturbances, cyber-attacks, on federated/distributed EC environment.
Identify quality issues with AI models implementation on edge and on offering mitigation strategies to resolve the challenges.
summary_1.collaboration: The post holder will be a highly productive, ambitious and collaborative member of the National Edge AI Hub research project.

eligibility.qualifications: Have or be about to obtain a PhD degree in Artificial Intelligence, Software Engineering, or Computer Science.
eligibility.special_considerations: Strong publication record commensurate with stage of career.

summary_6.department: School of Electronics, Electrical Engineering and Computer Science

main_activities_responsibilities: Undertaking research in the area of Artificial Intelligence, Software Engineering, Edge Computing, and/or Cybersecurity.

candidate_requirements.education: PhD in Artificial Intelligence, Software Engineering, or Computer Science.
research_experience: Hands-on experience with machine learning frameworks, such as PyTorch, Keras, or TensorFlow.
Solid understanding of edge intelligence and software vulnerabilities.
Working effectively as part of a research team in the development and promotion of the research theme.

benefits: Competitive salary, holiday entitlement of up to 8.4 weeks a year, pension schemes, development opportunities, support for physical and mental health.
summary_8.equality_commitment: Queen's University is committed to promoting equality of opportunity to all. We subscribe to Equality Charter Marks such as the Diversity Charter Mark NI and Athena Swan.
summary_8.visa_information: If you are an international applicant and don't already hold a visa that permits you to take up the role you are applying for, please use the information provided on our website to self-assess whether the University is likely to be able to support a visa application.
